title: Ellen Terry - Shakespeare, Shaw, and Ibsen

content.question: The author suggests that Shakespeare, Shaw, and Ibsen could not "fit" (Paragraph 3) Terry chiefly because

choices.label: the parts they created did not allow Terry to make use of every aspect of her talents
Terry was better at conveying certain kinds of characters and emotions than she was at conveying others
their plays were set in historical periods different from the one in which Terry lived
the speeches they wrote for their female characters were written in accents and dialects different from Terry's

content.answer: the parts they created did not allow Terry to make use of every aspect of her talents

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and explain claims and evidence within an argument.
